title: Rhinoplasty (Nose Job)
author: Shawna Seed

sections.heading: What Is a Rhinoplasty?
content: Rhinoplasty is surgery that can reshape your nose. Some people get it done for cosmetic reasons, such as changing the look of their nose or making it fit the proportions of their face better. Others may have it for medical reasons, to correct breathing problems caused by their nose's structure.
The procedure is also known as "nose reshaping," or a "nose job."
Whatever you call it, it's among the most popular plastic surgeries. More than 350,000 people in the U.S. have rhinoplasty every year.
Rhinoplasty cost
How much you'll pay for this surgery depends on many things, including the type of work the surgeon does and where you live.

According to the American Society of Plastic Surgeons, the average cost of rhinoplasty is $7,000-$8,000. However, that doesn't include anesthesia, facility fees, and other costs. The total price will be higher.

If you're having this surgery to correct a breathing problem, your health insurance may cover some of the costs. However, if you're having rhinoplasty to change your appearance, it's not covered by insurance.

sections.heading: Types of Rhinoplasty
content: Rhinoplasty can change the size of your nose, adjust the position of your nostrils, and remove visible humps, among other things. (Photo Credit: Creatas Video/Getty Images.)
Doctors divide rhinoplasty into two main types.
Open rhinoplasty. This involves a major reshaping of your nose. The surgeon completely separates the skin of your nose from the bone and cartilage underneath.
Closed rhinoplasty. This is a less invasive procedure that's done to make minor changes. The surgeon will make cuts inside your nose to separate skin from cartilage and bone.
Within those two main groups, there are other classifications. They include:
bullets: Tip plasty. This procedure focuses only on reshaping the tip of your nose. You'll receive a local anesthetic to numb your face rather than a general anesthetic, which makes you unconscious.
Revision rhinoplasty. This is sometimes called "secondary rhinoplasty." You'd have this procedure to correct issues after your first nose-reshaping surgery.
Functional rhinoplasty. If a disease such as cancer or a traumatic injury has damaged your nose, this procedure can restore its appearance and function.

sections.heading: Reasons for Getting a Rhinoplasty
content: Nose jobs can be done to change how you look or for medical reasons. For example, some people may need surgery to repair a problem with the cartilage that divides one nostril from the other. Others may just want to make their nose smaller or change its shape. Some issues nose-reshaping can fix include:
Rhinoplasty may also be part of treatment plans for some medical conditions, including:
bullets: Removing a hump on the nose
Straightening the bridge
Reshaping the nose's tip
Increasing or decreasing the size of the nostrils
Correcting the nose after an injury
Opening breathing passages
Making the nose bigger or smaller
Cleft lip
Craniosynostosis, a condition that causes the joints in a baby's skull to fuse too soon. This can affect facial features, including the nose.
Treacher Collins Syndrome, a genetic condition that affects the way a child's face develops. Doctors may delay rhinoplasty until the child grows into an adult.
Apert Syndrome, a genetic condition that affects a baby's face, hands, and feet. A child with Apert Syndrome might have several types of surgery, including rhinoplasty.

sections.heading: Realistic Expectations for Rhinoplasty
content: It's important to talk with your surgeon ahead of time about your goals for the surgery. The surgeon can help you set realistic expectations for what rhinoplasty can and can't do. Your surgery can improve your nose's appearance, but it can't make it perfect.
If you don't like your nose but can't express exactly what you don't like, you're less likely to be happy with your outcome.

You should have a thorough consultation before your surgery that includes photos. Your surgeon may use a computer software program to show you how your nose might change after surgery. Be aware, though, that a computer program might generate a nose that a surgeon simply can't reproduce. Ask to see the surgeon's before-and-after photos to get a feel for real results.

sections.heading: Deciding on a Nose Job
content: Look for a surgeon who is experienced in plastic surgery of the nose and has a reputation for patient satisfaction. The American Board of Plastic Surgery (ABPS) is the most common body that certifies rhinoplasty surgeons.

content_blocks.text: Look for a surgeon who is experienced in plastic surgery of the nose and has a reputation for patient satisfaction. The American Board of Plastic Surgery (ABPS) is the most common body that certifies rhinoplasty surgeons.

content: It's best to have this surgery done in an accredited facility. If you have a complication, an experienced surgeon working with a well-trained team will be able to assess and correct the situation.
Set up a meeting to talk about your goals and tell the doctor what bothers you about your nose and how you would like to change it.
The surgeon will examine the structures of your nose and other facial features. After this, they can tell you if your expectations are realistic.
The surgeon will also consider your overall health and should discuss with you the risks, recovery time, and costs involved.
There are various techniques for reshaping the nose. Once you decide to go ahead, your surgeon should describe exactly what they propose to do.

If you have health insurance, make sure you talk to your insurer in advance so you know what's covered and what you will need to pay for. Health insurance typically does not pay for procedures that are done only for cosmetic reasons.

sections.heading: Rhinoplasty Procedure
content: A nose job is usually done as an outpatient procedure, meaning you won’t need to stay overnight. You may get general or local anesthesia. With general anesthesia, you'll sleep through the operation. With local anesthesia, you will be sedated and your nose will be numbed so you are unable to feel the pain.

During an operation, the surgeon makes cuts within the nostrils. In more difficult cases, the surgeon may also make cuts across the base of the nose. The surgeon then reshapes the inner bone and cartilage to produce a more pleasing appearance.

content_blocks.text: A nose job is usually done as an outpatient procedure, meaning you won’t need to stay overnight. You may get general or local anesthesia. With general anesthesia, you'll sleep through the operation. With local anesthesia, you will be sedated and your nose will be numbed so you are unable to feel the pain.

During an operation, the surgeon makes cuts within the nostrils. In more difficult cases, the surgeon may also make cuts across the base of the nose. The surgeon then reshapes the inner bone and cartilage to produce a more pleasing appearance.

sections.heading: Rhinoplasty Recovery
content: After a nose job, people usually wear a nasal splint for the first week. You will need to keep your head elevated for at least 24 hours after the operation. You can expect swelling and some bruising around the eyes after surgery that will begin to improve after the third day. It can last up to 2 weeks.

Expect your nose to have a little swelling, which probably only you and your surgeon will notice. This will go away over the next 6 months. The final shape of your nose will be apparent after it has completely healed.

You should avoid intense activities for 3 to 6 weeks after surgery. You may return to your social activities as soon as within 2 to 3 weeks without any recognizable signs that you had a procedure done.

content_blocks.text: After a nose job, people usually wear a nasal splint for the first week. You will need to keep your head elevated for at least 24 hours after the operation. You can expect swelling and some bruising around the eyes after surgery that will begin to improve after the third day. It can last up to 2 weeks.

Expect your nose to have a little swelling, which probably only you and your surgeon will notice. This will go away over the next 6 months. The final shape of your nose will be apparent after it has completely healed.

You should avoid intense activities for 3 to 6 weeks after surgery. You may return to your social activities as soon as within 2 to 3 weeks without any recognizable signs that you had a procedure done.

sections.heading: Post-Rhinoplasty Pain
content: At the end of your surgery, your doctor might give you a long-lasting numbing treatment. You may have mild to moderate pain after that wears off. Generally, your pain should get better within a week.
Your doctor will give you instructions on how to manage your pain. Usually, this requires over-the-counter pain medicine.

content_blocks.text: At the end of your surgery, your doctor might give you a long-lasting numbing treatment. You may have mild to moderate pain after that wears off. Generally, your pain should get better within a week.
Your doctor will give you instructions on how to manage your pain. Usually, this requires over-the-counter pain medicine.

sections.heading: What Not to Do After Rhinoplasty
content: You can help your nose heal more quickly after surgery by following these guidelines:
bullets: Don't blow your nose.
Avoid anything hitting your face.
Don't let glasses or sunglasses put too much pressure on your nose.
Stay out of the sun.
Don't lift things that are heavy.
Take baths instead of showers while your nose is bandaged.
Skip taxing physical activities such as jogging.
Don't pull clothes -- such as shirts or sweaters -- over your head.
Don't close your mouth if you have to sneeze or cough.
Don't swim until your doctor gives you the OK.

sections.heading: Rhinoplasty Risks
content: Any type of surgery has risks. These include bleeding, infection, and allergic reactions to anesthesia. Risks of rhinoplasty include:
bullets: Numbness
Nosebleeds
Scarring at the base of the nose
Bursting of small blood vessels on the skin's surface
Swelling
Permanent nerve damage
Need for a second or third operation

content_blocks.text: Any type of surgery has risks. These include bleeding, infection, and allergic reactions to anesthesia. Risks of rhinoplasty include:

Swelling

sections.heading: Who Shouldn't Get a Rhinoplasty?
content: Some people aren't good candidates for nose-reshaping surgery. Among them are:
bullets: Teens whose noses haven't reached adult size yet
People with sleep apnea
Smokers
Cocaine users
Those with bleeding disorders
Anyone who's had rhinoplasty within the last year
Anyone with body dysmorphic disorder, a psychiatric condition

content_blocks.text: Some people aren't good candidates for nose-reshaping surgery. Among them are:

People with sleep apnea
Smokers
Cocaine users
Those with bleeding disorders
Anyone who's had rhinoplasty within the last year
Anyone with body dysmorphic disorder, a psychiatric condition

sections.heading: Alternatives to Nose Surgery
content: You might be able to address issues with your nose using nonsurgical approaches. Options include:
Liquid rhinoplasty

This is sometimes called "nonsurgical rhinoplasty." The doctor injects dermal fillers into your nose. It's an option when you have a spot issue, such as a bump or lump. You might have this after a nose job to correct minor problems. You get quicker results with liquid rhinoplasty and less downtime. The results aren't permanent.
Radiofrequency rhinoplasty

In this procedure, a small probe heats the cartilage of your nose, which softens it. While it's soft, it can be slightly reshaped. The probe also heats the tissue, prompting it to produce more collagen and elastin. Those who offer this procedure say it can tighten the skin around your nose. A session takes 60 to 90 minutes and doesn't require anesthesia, just numbing your face.

content_blocks.text: You might be able to address issues with your nose using nonsurgical approaches. Options include:
Liquid rhinoplasty

This is sometimes called "nonsurgical rhinoplasty." The doctor injects dermal fillers into your nose. It's an option when you have a spot issue, such as a bump or lump. You might have this after a nose job to correct minor problems. You get quicker results with liquid rhinoplasty and less downtime. The results aren't permanent.
Radiofrequency rhinoplasty

In this procedure, a small probe heats the cartilage of your nose, which softens it. While it's soft, it can be slightly reshaped. The probe also heats the tissue, prompting it to produce more collagen and elastin. Those who offer this procedure say it can tighten the skin around your nose. A session takes 60 to 90 minutes and doesn't require anesthesia, just numbing your face.

sections.heading: Nose shaping tools
content: You can buy devices over the counter that claim to reshape your nose. They include tools you can clip onto the bridge of your nose or insert into your nostrils. There's little evidence to suggest these products work, and they can injure your nose.
Nose thread lift

This procedure uses a special type of thread. These threads are placed into your nose using small cuts. Then, these are pulled tight and anchored to tissue underneath. This can lift your nose tissue. It takes about an hour in a doctor's office, and you can return to your normal routine within a few days. The procedure is a possibility if you want minor changes. The effect lasts a year or so.

content_blocks.text: You can buy devices over the counter that claim to reshape your nose. They include tools you can clip onto the bridge of your nose or insert into your nostrils. There's little evidence to suggest these products work, and they can injure your nose.
Nose thread lift

This procedure uses a special type of thread. These threads are placed into your nose using small cuts. Then, these are pulled tight and anchored to tissue underneath. This can lift your nose tissue. It takes about an hour in a doctor's office, and you can return to your normal routine within a few days. The procedure is a possibility if you want minor changes. The effect lasts a year or so.

sections.heading: Rhinoplasty Risks
content: Any type of surgery has risks. These include bleeding, infection, and allergic reactions to anesthesia. Risks of rhinoplasty include:
bullets: Numbness
Nosebleeds
Scarring at the base of the nose
Bursting of small blood vessels on the skin's surface
Swelling
Permanent nerve damage
Need for a second or third operation

Swelling

Need for a second or third operation

sections.heading: Who Shouldn't Get a Rhinoplasty?
content: Some people aren't good candidates for nose-reshaping surgery. Among them are:
bullets: Teens whose noses haven't reached adult size yet
People with sleep apnea
Smokers
Cocaine users
Those with bleeding disorders
Anyone who's had rhinoplasty within the last year
Anyone with body dysmorphic disorder, a psychiatric condition

sections.heading: Alternatives to Nose Surgery
content: You might be able to address issues with your nose using nonsurgical approaches. Options include:
Liquid rhinoplasty

This is sometimes called "nonsurgical rhinoplasty." The doctor injects dermal fillers into your nose. It's an option when you have a spot issue, such as a bump or lump. You might have this after a nose job to correct minor problems. You get quicker results with liquid rhinoplasty and less downtime. The results aren't permanent.
Radiofrequency rhinoplasty

In this procedure, a small probe heats the cartilage of your nose, which softens it. While it's soft, it can be slightly reshaped. The probe also heats the tissue, prompting it to produce more collagen and elastin. Those who offer this procedure say it can tighten the skin around your nose. A session takes 60 to 90 minutes and doesn't require anesthesia, just numbing your face.

sections.heading: Takeaways
content: Rhinoplasty is a surgery that changes the shape of your nose. It's also called a nose job or nose reshaping. It's one of the most common plastic surgery procedures in the U.S. Some people have it to correct a medical problem, but it's often done for cosmetic reasons. You might have swelling, bruising, and pain after the surgery. It usually takes about a year for your nose to heal and take its final shape.

content_blocks.text: Rhinoplasty is a surgery that changes the shape of your nose. It's also called a nose job or nose reshaping. It's one of the most common plastic surgery procedures in the U.S. Some people have it to correct a medical problem, but it's often done for cosmetic reasons. You might have swelling, bruising, and pain after the surgery. It usually takes about a year for your nose to heal and take its final shape.

sections.heading: Rhinoplasty FAQs
content: Can teenagers get a nose job?

Surgeons generally prefer to wait until your nose has reached its adult shape. For girls and those assigned female at birth, that's at age 15 or 16. For boys and those assigned male at birth, it takes a few more years.
What are the benefits of rhinoplasty?
If you're unhappy with the size or shape of your nose, rhinoplasty may be able to address your concerns. It also can fix problems with the structure of your nose and improve breathing.
How long is the recovery period after rhinoplasty?

You should plan for a week away from school or work after your surgery. After a week, most people can go back to their normal routine. Your nose will be swollen, and it may take months for that to resolve fully. It takes about a year for your nose to heal completely and that's when you see the final results.
Is rhinoplasty reversible?

Rhinoplasty permanently changes the shape of your nose. If you're not happy with the outcome of your surgery, you can have additional procedures, known as secondary rhinoplasty or revision rhinoplasty.

Your nose will be swollen, and it may take months for that to resolve fully. It takes about a year for your nose to heal completely and that's when you see the final results.
Is rhinoplasty reversible?

Rhinoplasty permanently changes the shape of your nose. If you're not happy with the outcome of your surgery, you can have additional procedures, known as secondary rhinoplasty or revision rhinoplasty.

sections.heading: Will there be scarring after a nose job?
content: If you have a closed rhinoplasty, you'll have incisions inside your nose. That leaves no visible scar. An open rhinoplasty involves cutting on the surface of your face. Most scars fade over time.

meta_description: Rhinoplasty is a surgery on your nose for medical or cosmetic reasons. Know everything about the procedure: benefits, risks & recovery tips.
